thread.title: A look at Chris Laviano's first 3 starts compared to past Rutgers quarterbacks
thread.title_full: A look at Chris Laviano's first 3 starts compared to past Rutgers quarterbacks

author: Keith Sargeant | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: A look at Chris Laviano's first 3 starts compared to past Rutgers quarterbacks
text:
Comments 
Chris Laviano has one thing going for him that the past Rutgers starting quarterbacks didn't: Experience. 
Ryan Hart, Tom Savage, Chas Dodd and Gary Nova all started games as true freshmen, while Mike Teel saw his first collegiate action as a redshirt freshman. 
Laviano took a redshirt as a true freshman before serving as the backup to Nova last season, seeing action in five games in mostly mop-up duty. 
This is to say that comparing Laviano's first three collegiate starts to his five predecessors deserves an asterisk. 
Still: Laviano statistics compare favorably to the five Rutgers signal callers that stood under center before him. 
PLUS: Rutgers quarterback Chris Laviano 'up-and-down' in win over Kansas 
Laviano has seen action each week through Rutgers' 2-2 start, starting the last three at quarterback. Overall, the Long Island, N.Y., native is leading the Big Ten in completion percentage (72.0) while passing for 794 yards, six touchdowns and five interceptions. 
Some of those totals were padded by the Week 1 triumph over Norfolk State, a game in which Laviano completed all four of his passes for 138 yards and three touchdowns while playing only in the second half. 
ALSO: Where are the downfield passes? 
The photo gallery above illustrates that Laviano's 656 passing yards through his first three starts are greater than all five of his predecessors and he's shown the most accuracy in terms of completion percentage.
